Auto-generated · 481 endpoints
REST API Reference

Muvi Platform API

Interactive API documentation organized as a user-journey storybook. Each chapter follows what actually happens ‚Äî from the moment an admin opens the CMS, to a customer browsing movies and booking tickets. Guest users can browse without any auth token.

481 endpoints
24 chapters
127 public (no auth)
354 authenticated

Before You Start Testing

354 out of 481 endpoints require authentication. If you try to call them without a token, you will get a 500 or 401 error.

You must complete the authentication steps below first to get a Bearer token. Once obtained, it will be automatically applied to all requests.

Not authenticated — complete the steps below

How to Authenticate

Choose a method below. The token is auto-saved so you don’t need to copy-paste anything.

⚡

CMS Login

POST /cms/auth/login

Log in with the seeded CMS admin account. This works instantly in local dev — no external services required.

Pre-seeded credentials

Email: admin@muvi.local

Password: Admin1234

Click “Log in” to authenticate.
✓ Authentication Successful!

Your Bearer token has been auto-saved to the Authorization field in the sidebar. All “Try it” buttons will use it automatically.

Note: The CMS token grants access to CMS endpoints (/cms/*). Mobile-only endpoints (e.g. /auth/me) require a mobile OTP token.

⚠ Local Dev Limitation: The send-otp step works (SMS is mocked), but verify-otp may fail because the Vista loyalty service is not mocked in NODE_ENV=local. Use CMS Login above for reliable local testing.

1 Enter phone
2 Send OTP (mocked)
3 Verify OTP → Token
1

Send OTP

POST /auth/send-otp

Enter your phone number below and click “Send OTP”. In local dev, no real SMS is sent.

Format: international with country code, e.g. +966XXXXXXXXX

Response will appear here after you click “Send OTP”.
2

Verify OTP & Get Token

POST /auth/verify-otp

Enter the 4-digit code below. In local dev, use test code 5555. On success, your Bearer token will be automatically saved to the sidebar.

Local dev test code: 5555 (no SMS sent locally). Production uses real 6-digit OTP via SMS.

Response will appear here after you click “Verify”.
✓ Authentication Successful!

Your Bearer token has been auto-saved to the Authorization field in the sidebar. All “Try it” buttons will use it automatically.

What happens next?

  • ✓ The token is automatically pasted into the Authorization field in the sidebar on the left.
  • ✓ Every “Try it →” button below will include this token as a Bearer header.
  • ✓ Endpoints marked AUTH will now return real data instead of 401/500 errors.
  • ⓘ If your token expires, come back to this section and repeat the flow to get a new one.
CMS
Part I ‚Äî CMS (Admin Panel)

Your team lead sits you down: ‚ÄúLet me walk you through the admin panel. This is where we manage movies, cinemas, offers, and everything else.‚Äù

Chapter 1
üîê

Authentication & Profile

2 public / 6 auth 8 endpoints

The admin opens the CMS and logs in.

The CMS is a React + Vite admin panel. When an admin opens it, the first thing they see is the login screen. After signing in with email + password, the app stores a JWT and loads their role & permissions.

Admin opens CMS
Login page renders
POST cms/auth/login
Store token + permissions
Redirect to /app

auth

8 endpoints

POST /cms/auth/auth-refresh AUTH main-backend-microservices/alpha-muvi-gateway-main/src/identity/controllers/cms-auth.controller.ts
Headers
Acceptapplication/jsonrequired
accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Content-Typeapplication/jsonrequired
AuthorizationBearer <token>required
Example Request
$ curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/cms/auth/auth-refresh \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{}'
Request Body (editable JSON)
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.
PATCH /cms/auth/change-password AUTH main-backend-microservices/alpha-muvi-gateway-main/src/identity/controllers/cms-auth.controller.ts
Headers
Acceptapplication/jsonrequired
accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Content-Typeapplication/jsonrequired
AuthorizationBearer <token>required
Arguments
oldPasswordstringrequired
newPasswordstringrequired
Example Request
$ curl -X PATCH http://localhost:3000/api/v1/cms/auth/change-password \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "oldPassword": "123456",
        "newPassword": "123456"
      }'
Request Body (editable JSON)
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

Chapter 2
üìä

Dashboard, Settings & Global Config

4 public / 13 auth 17 endpoints

What loads when the admin lands on /app.

After login the app redirects to /app. The dashboard immediately fetches global settings (checkout timeouts, maintenance mode) and financial data (transactions, Mada card BINs).

Dashboard mounts
GET cms/settings
GET cms/transactions
GET cms/cards/mada-card-bins

cards

2 endpoints

Example Request
$ curl -X PATCH http://localhost:3000/api/v1/cms/settings \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "OTPCountDown": "123456",
        "experienceDescriptionEn": "Sample description text",
        "experienceDescriptionAr": "Sample description text",
        "maxSeats": 10,
        "voucherRedemptionDescriptionEn": "Sample description text",
        "voucherRedemptionDescriptionAr": "Sample description text",
        "offerDescriptionAr": "Sample description text",
        "offerDescriptionEn": "Sample description text",
        "contactUsDescriptionAr": "Sample description text",
        "contactUsDescriptionEn": "Sample description text",
        "foodMenuDescriptionAr": "Sample description text",
        "foodMenuDescriptionEn": "Sample description text",
        "timer": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "checkGapBetweenSeatsRule": true,
        "checkGapWithPathRule": true,
        "fbTimer": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "vatNumber": true,
        "autoRestart": true,
        "countDaysNewBookmark": true,
        "smsGateway": true,
        "kioskTicketingOrderTimer": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",

        "stcBankAccountId": "01HZYXWVUTS1234567890ABCDE",
        "tabbyMinAmount": true,
        "tabbyDescriptionEn": 10,
        "tabbyDescriptionAr": 10
      }'

  -d '{
        "property": "string_value",
        "validationOptions": "value",

Chapter 3
üé¨

Movies, Genres, Ratings & Casting

AUTH 39 endpoints

The admin navigates to the Movies section.

Movies originate from Vista (the cinema management backend) and are synced into Muvi. The admin can sync, edit translations, assign genres/cast, and publish/unpublish films.

Vista System
POST cms/films/sync
Muvi DB
GET cms/films
Movies List Page

PUT /cms/films/:id AUTH main-backend-microservices/alpha-muvi-gateway-main/src/main/controllers/cms-film.controller.ts
Headers
Acceptapplication/jsonrequired
accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Content-Typeapplication/jsonrequired
AuthorizationBearer <token>required
Arguments
titleEnstringrequired
titleArstringrequired
rateIdnumberrequired
synopsisArstringrequired
synopsisEnstringrequired
bookmarkIdnumberoptional
runtimenumberoptional
releaseDatestringoptional
trailerUrlstringoptional
subtitleArstringoptional
movieLangArstringoptional
subtitleEnstringoptional
movieLangEnstringoptional
typeFilmTypesEnumoptional
genresnumber[]optional
isPublishedbooleanoptional
imagestringoptional
coverUrlstringoptional
startDateBookmarkstringoptional
endDateBookmarkstringoptional
Example Request
$ curl -X PUT http://localhost:3000/api/v1/cms/films/:id \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "titleEn": "Sample Name",
        "titleAr": "Sample Name",
        "rateId": "01HZYXWVUTS1234567890ABCDE",
        "synopsisAr": 10,
        "synopsisEn": 10,
        "bookmarkId": "01HZYXWVUTS1234567890ABCDE",
        "runtime": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "releaseDate": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "trailerUrl": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "subtitleAr": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "movieLangAr": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "subtitleEn": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "movieLangEn": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "type": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "genres": 10,
        "isPublished": true,
        "image": true,
        "coverUrl": true,
        "startDateBookmark": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "endDateBookmark": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z"
      }'
Request Body (editable JSON)
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

Content-Typeapplication/jsonrequired
AuthorizationBearer <token>required
Example Request
$ curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/cms/genres/cron-sync \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{}'

Chapter 4
üè¢

Cinemas, Cities & Experiences

AUTH 28 endpoints

Managing cinema locations, city ordering, and screen experiences.

Cinemas are organized by city. The admin manages cities, then within each city manages cinemas and their display order. Experiences like IMAX, VIP, 4DX are managed separately and linked to specific screens.

GET cms/cities
Select a city
GET cms/cinemas
Edit cinema details
Manage experiences

cinemas

ordernumberrequired
Example Request
$ curl -X PUT http://localhost:3000/api/v1/cms/cities/:cityId/films/:filmId \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "order": 10
      }'
Request Body (editable JSON)
Response

Chapter 5
üìÖ

Showtimes & Sessions

AUTH 7 endpoints

Showtimes are synced from Vista ‚Äî each links a movie to a cinema screen.

Showtimes (sessions) come from Vista. Each session links a specific movie to a cinema screen at a date/time. Admins can view the full schedule and trigger manual syncs.

Admin clicks Sync
POST cms/sessions/sync
Vista ‚Üí Muvi DB
GET cms/sessions
Showtimes table

Chapter 6
üéÅ

Banners, Offers & Offer Rules

AUTH 23 endpoints

The admin sets up homepage banners and promotional offers.

Banners appear in the homepage carousel. Offers can target specific movies, cinemas, dates, and user segments. Offer rules are reusable conditions (e.g. ‚Äúweekend only‚Äù, ‚Äúmin 2 tickets‚Äù).

Create banner
Create offer rule
Create offer
Attach rules
Publish

banners

6 endpoints

POST /cms/banners AUTH main-backend-microservices/alpha-muvi-gateway-main/src/main/controllers/cms-banner.controller.ts
Headers
Acceptapplication/jsonrequired
accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Content-Typeapplication/jsonrequired
AuthorizationBearer <token>required
Arguments
imageEnstringrequired
imageArstringrequired
bannerableTypeBannerTyperequired
bannerableIdstringrequired
urlEnstringrequired
urlArstringrequired
buttonTextArstringrequired
buttonTextEnstringrequired
coverUrlEnstringrequired
coverUrlArstringrequired
Example Request
$ curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/cms/banners \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "imageEn": "https://example.com/image.png",
        "imageAr": "https://example.com/image.png",
        "bannerableType": "value",
        "bannerableId": "01HZYXWVUTS1234567890ABCDE",
        "urlEn": "https://example.com/image.png",
        "urlAr": "https://example.com/image.png",
        "buttonTextAr": "Sample description text",
        "buttonTextEn": "Sample description text",
        "coverUrlEn": "https://example.com/image.png",
        "coverUrlAr": "https://example.com/image.png"
      }'
Request Body (editable JSON)
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

Chapter 7
üë•

Users, Roles & Permissions

AUTH 20 endpoints

The admin manages team access ‚Äî who can see and do what.

Not every CMS user can see everything. The RBAC system has Permissions (resource + action pairs) ‚Üí attached to Roles ‚Üí assigned to Users. Each route checks permissions.

GET cms/permissions
Create Role
Assign permissions
Create User
Assign role

contact-us

2 endpoints

x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
AuthorizationBearer <token>required

limitnumberoptional
pagenumberoptional
filterstring[]optional
sortstring[]optional

  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

Headers

accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Content-Typeapplication/jsonrequired
AuthorizationBearer <token>required
Arguments
emailstringrequired
firstNamestringrequired
lastNamestringrequired
roles[number]required
employeeIdstringrequired
statusUserStatusrequired
phoneNumberstringrequired
cinemasIdsArray<number>optional
Example Request
$ curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/cms/users \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "email": "user@example.com",
        "firstName": "user@example.com",
        "lastName": "user@example.com",
        "roles": "user@example.com",
        "employeeId": "user@example.com",
        "status": "user@example.com",
        "phoneNumber": "user@example.com",
        "cinemasIds": "user@example.com"
      }'

Chapter 8
üõí

Customers, Orders & Refunds

AUTH 29 endpoints

The admin monitors customer bookings, processes refunds, and manages customer accounts.

This is the ops team‚Äôs daily view. They can look up customers (registered + guest), view all ticket orders, resend confirmation emails, and process refunds when needed.

GET cms/users/customers
GET cms/orders
View order detail
Process refund
Resend email

cancellation-reasons

6 endpoints

POST /cms/cancellation-reasons AUTH main-backend-microservices/alpha-muvi-gateway-main/src/main/controllers/cms-cancellation-reason.controller.ts
Headers
Acceptapplication/jsonrequired
accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Content-Typeapplication/jsonrequired
AuthorizationBearer <token>required
Arguments

titleArstringrequired

  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "titleEn": "Sample Name",
        "titleAr": "Sample Name",
        "appearsTo": "string_value"
      }'

$ curl -X GET http://localhost:3000/api/v1/cms/refund-payment-logs \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

Chapter 9
üçø

Food & Beverages, Bank Accounts

AUTH 14 endpoints

The admin configures the F&B menu and payment settlement accounts.

The food menu has tabs, items, modifier groups, and up-sell items. Bank accounts are used for payment settlements with the payment gateway.

Configure menu tabs
Add menu items
Set modifiers
Add up-sells
Manage bank accounts

bank-accounts

5 endpoints

Chapter 10
üîî

Notifications & Push Templates

AUTH 3 endpoints

The admin creates and sends push notifications to users.

Notification templates can target all users, specific movie watchers, or frequent cinema visitors. They can be scheduled or sent immediately.

Create template
Set target audience
Choose schedule
Publish/Send

notification-templates

3 endpoints

        "titleEn": "Sample Name",

        "watchedFilmId": "01HZYXWVUTS1234567890ABCDE",
        "filmId": "01HZYXWVUTS1234567890ABCDE",
        "lastBookingFrom": "string_value",
        "lastBookingTo": "string_value",
        "imageUrl": "https://example.com/image.png",
        "expiryDate": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",

Chapter 11
üìÑ

SEO, Dynamic Pages & Onboarding

5 public / 11 auth 16 endpoints

The admin manages website content, SEO metadata, and mobile app onboarding slides.

SEO metadata controls how pages appear in Google. Dynamic pages hold content for About Us, Privacy Policy, T&C. Onboarding slides are shown to first-time mobile app users.

Edit page SEO meta
Edit dynamic pages
Manage onboarding slides
Voucher redemption steps

dynamic-pages

2 endpoints

PUT /cms/dynamic-pages/:id AUTH main-backend-microservices/alpha-muvi-gateway-main/src/identity/controllers/cms-dynamic-page.controller.ts
Headers
Acceptapplication/jsonrequired
accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Content-Typeapplication/jsonrequired
AuthorizationBearer <token>required
Arguments
photoUrlstringrequired
contentEnstringrequired
contentArstringrequired
Example Request
$ curl -X PUT http://localhost:3000/api/v1/cms/dynamic-pages/:id \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "photoUrl": "https://example.com/image.png",
        "contentEn": "string_value",
        "contentAr": "string_value"
      }'
Request Body (editable JSON)
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

Headers

accept-languageEN | ARrequired

Headers
Acceptapplication/jsonrequired
accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Content-Typeapplication/jsonrequired
AuthorizationBearer <token>required
Arguments
titleTagArstringrequired
titleTagEnstringrequired
descriptionTagArstringrequired
descriptionTagEnstringrequired
canonicalURLArstringoptional
canonicalURLEnstringoptional
hasIndexbooleanoptional
hasFollowbooleanoptional
Example Request
$ curl -X PUT http://localhost:3000/api/v1/cms/page-meta-data/:id \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "titleTagAr": "Sample Name",
        "titleTagEn": "Sample Name",
        "descriptionTagAr": "Sample description text",
        "descriptionTagEn": "Sample description text",
        "canonicalURLAr": true,
        "canonicalURLEn": true,
        "hasIndex": true,
        "hasFollow": true
      }'

Chapter 12
‚öôÔ∏è

Logs, Files, Kiosks & Misc

7 public / 83 auth 90 endpoints

System tools: audit trails, file uploads, kiosk management, and avatars.

Every CMS action is logged in the audit trail. File uploads go to CDN. Kiosk terminals are registered and configured per cinema. Avatars are the profile pictures users can choose from.

View audit logs
Upload files ‚Üí CDN
Manage kiosks
Manage avatars

11 endpoints

AuthorizationBearer <token>required
Query Parameters
limitnumberoptional
pagenumberoptional
filterstring[]optional

  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \

Arguments

  -d '{
        "memberId": "01HZYXWVUTS1234567890ABCDE",
        "amount": 10,
        "reference": 10,
        "expirationDate": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "type": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",

x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Content-Typeapplication/jsonrequired
AuthorizationBearer <token>required
Arguments
titlestringrequired
tokenstringrequired
cinemaIdnumberrequired
Example Request
$ curl -X PUT http://localhost:3000/api/v1/cms/menus/:id \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "title": "Sample Name",
        "token": "tok_sample_1234567890",
        "cinemaId": "01HZYXWVUTS1234567890ABCDE"
      }'
Request Body (editable JSON)
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

Headers

Arguments

Example Request
$ curl -X PUT http://localhost:3000/api/v1/cms/upselling-items/:id \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "upsellingItems": [
          "item1",
          "item2"
        ],
        "concessionItemId": "01HZYXWVUTS1234567890ABCDE",
        "nameAr": [
          "item1",
          "item2"
        ],
        "nameEn": [
          "item1",
          "item2"
        ],
        "sort": 10,
        "size": 10,
        "isDefault": true
      }'

Kiosk
Kiosk

Standalone self-service terminals in cinema lobbies. They authenticate with kiosk keys, not user tokens.

Chapter 13
üñ•Ô∏è

Kiosk Endpoints

NO AUTH 21 endpoints

A customer walks up to a self-service kiosk in the cinema lobby.

Kiosks are standalone terminals in cinema lobbies. They authenticate with a kiosk key + ID (not user tokens). Customers can browse movies, select seats, add food, and pay ‚Äî all on the kiosk screen.

Kiosk boots
Auth via kiosk key
Browse showtimes
Select seats
Order food
Pay at kiosk

fb

8 endpoints

GET /fb/orders/:id/check-seat-delivery KIOSK main-backend-microservices/alpha-muvi-gateway-main/src/fb/controllers/food-order.controller.ts
Headers
Acceptapplication/jsonrequired
accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
x-kiosk-idkiosk_01HZYX...required
x-kiosk-keykiosk_key_valrequired

$ curl -X GET http://localhost:3000/api/v1/fb/orders/:id/check-seat-delivery \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "x-kiosk-id: kiosk_01HZYX..." \
  -H "x-kiosk-key: kiosk_key_val"

Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

Website
Part II ‚Äî Website (Customer Journey)

‚ÄúNow let‚Äôs see what the customer sees.‚Äù Open muvicinemas.com. A guest can browse movies, cinemas, and showtimes without any login. Auth is only needed for booking, payments, and profile.

Chapter 14
üåê

Website Boots: Settings, Cities & Banners

NO AUTH 6 endpoints

A customer opens muvicinemas.com ‚Äî these APIs fire immediately, no login needed.

The moment the page loads, the Next.js app fetches platform settings (is maintenance mode on?), the list of cities (for the city selector), banners (for the hero carousel), and SEO metadata. None of these require authentication.

User opens website
GET settings
GET cities
GET banners
GET page-meta-data
Homepage renders!

banners

1 endpoints

GET /banners main-backend-microservices/alpha-muvi-gateway-main/src/main/controllers/banner.controller.ts
Headers
Acceptapplication/jsonrequired
accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Example Request
$ curl -X GET http://localhost:3000/api/v1/banners \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk"
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

Chapter 15
üì±

Sign Up, Login & OTP

7 public / 26 auth 33 endpoints

The customer clicks ‚ÄúBook Now‚Äù and is asked to sign in with their phone number.

Unlike the CMS (email+password), the website uses phone number + OTP. The user enters their phone, receives an SMS code, and verifies it. New users complete a profile. Email verification and phone change flows are also here.

User clicks Book
Login modal opens
Enter phone
POST auth/send-otp
Enter OTP
POST auth/verify-otp
Authenticated!

auth

31 endpoints

POST /auth/add-token AUTH main-backend-microservices/alpha-muvi-gateway-main/src/identity/controllers/auth.controller.ts
Headers
Acceptapplication/jsonrequired
accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Content-Typeapplication/jsonrequired
AuthorizationBearer <token>required
Arguments
tokenstringrequired
Example Request
$ curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/auth/add-token \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "token": "tok_sample_1234567890"
      }'
Request Body (editable JSON)
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

  -d '{
        "firstName": "Sample Name",
        "lastName": "Sample Name",
        "dateOfBirth": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "gender": "value",
        "photoUrl": "https://example.com/image.png"
      }'
Request Body (editable JSON)
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

Chapter 16
üé•

Browsing Movies

NO AUTH 10 endpoints

The customer scrolls through Now Showing and Coming Soon on the homepage.

The homepage shows movies grouped by bookmark (Now Showing, Coming Soon, Advance Booking). Clicking a movie poster opens the detail page with trailer, cast, description, and a list of cinemas showing it. All public ‚Äî no login needed.

Homepage
GET films (Now Showing)
Click movie poster
GET films/:slug
Movie detail page
GET films/:id/cinemas

films

10 endpoints

  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk"

Chapter 17
üîç

Movie Finder & Search

NO AUTH 12 endpoints

The customer opens the Movie Finder to search across dates, cinemas, and experiences.

Movie Finder is a powerful multi-filter tool. It loads available dates, then lets the user filter by movie, cinema, and experience (IMAX, VIP). Results show matching showtimes grouped by movie. There‚Äôs also a text search bar with recent search history. All public.

Open Movie Finder
GET .../dates
GET .../filters/films
GET .../filters/cinemas
Select filters
GET film-finder
Results!

film-finder

9 endpoints

GET /film-finder main-backend-microservices/alpha-muvi-gateway-main/src/main/controllers/film-finder.controller.ts

accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Query Parameters
limitnumberoptional
pagenumberoptional
Example Request
$ curl -X GET http://localhost:3000/api/v1/film-finder \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk"
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

Chapter 18
üèüÔ∏è

Cinemas & Experiences

NO AUTH 13 endpoints

The customer browses the cinema directory, views showtimes at a specific location.

The Cinemas page lists all locations with their experiences. Clicking a cinema shows its detail page ‚Äî description, photos, map, and today‚Äôs showtimes. Experiences (IMAX, VIP, 4DX) have their own pages too. All public.

GET cinemas
Click cinema
GET cinemas/:slug
GET showtimes
Select a showtime

Chapter 19
üé´

Booking, Orders & Cancellations

7 public / 16 auth 23 endpoints

The customer selects a showtime ‚Üí picks seats ‚Üí adds food ‚Üí books ‚Üí and can later view, share, or cancel tickets.

This is the money flow. After selecting a showtime, the seat map loads. The customer picks seats, optionally adds food, and the system creates a pending order with a 10-minute checkout timeout. After payment, tickets appear in My Bookings with QR codes. Customers can share tickets, set reminders, and cancel (with time-based refund policies).

Select showtime
GET .../seats
Select seats
POST orders
Add food?
Apply offer?
Pay
My Bookings
Cancel?

Headers
Acceptapplication/jsonrequired
accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Content-Typeapplication/jsonrequired
Arguments
tokenstringrequired
paymentStrategyPaymentStrategyrequired
successWebUrlstringoptional
failedWebUrlstringoptional
clientDatestringoptional
userAgentstringoptional
timezonenumberoptional
screenWidthnumberoptional
screenHeightnumberoptional

lastNamestringoptional

binstringoptional

cardBinstringoptional
expiryMonthstringoptional
expiryYearstringoptional
cvvstringoptional

appleDatastringoptional

applePublicKeyHashstringrequired
appleDisplayNamestringrequired
appleNetworkstringrequired
appleTypestringrequired
checkoutPaymentContextstringoptional
otpstringoptional
Example Request
$ curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/guest-users/orders/:id/pay \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
        "token": "tok_sample_1234567890",
        "paymentStrategy": "string_value",
        "successWebUrl": "https://example.com/image.png",
        "failedWebUrl": "https://example.com/image.png",
        "clientDate": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "userAgent": "string_value",
        "timezone": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "screenWidth": 10,
        "screenHeight": 10,
        "phoneNumber": "+966500000000",
        "firstName": 10,
        "lastName": 10,
        "email": "user@example.com",
        "isApplePay": "user@example.com",
        "bin": "user@example.com",
        "cardLast4": "user@example.com",
        "cardBin": "user@example.com",
        "expiryMonth": "user@example.com",
        "expiryYear": "user@example.com",
        "cvv": "user@example.com",
        "payForLimit": "user@example.com",
        "isApplePayment": "user@example.com",
        "appleData": "user@example.com",
        "appleSignature": true,
        "appleTransactionId": "01HZYXWVUTS1234567890ABCDE",
        "appleEphemeralPublicKey": "string_value",
        "applePublicKeyHash": "string_value",
        "appleDisplayName": "Sample Name",
        "appleNetwork": "string_value",
        "appleType": "string_value",
        "checkoutPaymentContext": "Sample description text",
        "otp": "123456"
      }'

$ curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/orders/:id/cancel \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "cancellationReasonId": "01HZYXWVUTS1234567890ABCDE"
      }'

Chapter 20
üí≥

Payment & Credit Cards

5 public / 8 auth 13 endpoints

The customer pays for their booking ‚Äî card management, Apple Pay, STC Pay.

Users can save multiple cards (VISA, Mada, Mastercard). The system detects Mada cards via BIN check for special KSA processing. Payment supports 3DS verification, Apple Pay, and STC Pay.

GET cards
Choose card
POST orders/:id/pay
3DS redirect?
CONFIRMED!

cards

10 endpoints

GET /cards AUTH main-backend-microservices/alpha-muvi-gateway-main/src/payment/controllers/card.controller.ts

accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
AuthorizationBearer <token>required
Query Parameters

limitquery param

  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"

Chapter 21
üí∞

Wallet & Top-ups

5 public / 8 auth 13 endpoints

The customer manages their digital wallet ‚Äî refunds land here, and they can top up.

The wallet stores refund credits and manual top-ups. Users can view balance, transaction history, and add money using saved cards. Wallet credits can expire.

GET wallet/balance
View transactions
POST top-ups
POST top-ups/:id/pay
Balance updated

top-ups

3 endpoints

  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{}'

  -d '{
        "cardId": "01HZYXWVUTS1234567890ABCDE",
        "token": 10,
        "paymentStrategy": 10,
        "cvv": 10,
        "userAgent": 10,
        "timezone": "2026-01-15T12:00:00.000Z",
        "amount": 10,
        "screenWidth": 10,
        "screenHeight": 10,
        "appleData": 10,
        "appleSignature": 10,
        "appleTransactionId": "01HZYXWVUTS1234567890ABCDE",
        "appleEphemeralPublicKey": "string_value",
        "applePublicKeyHash": "string_value",
        "appleDisplayName": "Sample Name",
        "appleNetwork": "string_value",
        "appleType": "string_value",
        "isApplePayment": true,
        "checkoutPaymentContext": true,
        "otp": "123456"
      }'
Request Body (editable JSON)
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

Chapter 22
üéÅ

Offers & Vouchers

NO AUTH 7 endpoints

The customer browses active promotions and applies voucher codes at checkout.

The Offers page lists all active promotions. Each offer has terms, applicable movies/cinemas, and available showtimes. Voucher codes can be entered at checkout for additional discounts.

GET offers
View offer detail
See applicable showtimes
Apply voucher at checkout

Chapter 23
üë§

Profile, Notifications & Everything Else

1 public / 10 auth 11 endpoints

The customer manages their profile, reads notifications, and uploads files.

Users can update their name, avatar, preferred city, and language. Push notifications show movie alerts, booking confirmations, and promotional offers. The notification bell badge shows unread count.

PUT auth/profile
PATCH users/cities
GET notifications
Mark as read
Upload avatar

Static Pages, Contact & Misc

20 public / 5 auth 25 endpoints

About Us, Privacy Policy, Contact form, private booking requests ‚Äî the remaining pages.

These are the static content pages (rendered from CMS-managed content), the Contact Us form, private/corporate booking requests, and file upload utilities.

GET dynamic-pages/:type
GET voucher-redemption-steps
POST contact-us
POST private-bookings

Arguments
name"IncludeString", async: false })required
argsValidationArguments) {required
customerNamestringoptional
emailstringoptional
phoneNumberstringoptional
cinemaIdnumberoptional
cityIdnumberoptional

subcategoryContactUsSubCategoryEnumoptional
subjectstringoptional

Example Request
$ curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/contact-us \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "name": "Sample Name",
        "args": "value",
        "customerName": "Sample Name",
        "email": "user@example.com",
        "phoneNumber": "user@example.com",
        "cinemaId": "user@example.com",
        "cityId": "user@example.com",
        "category": "user@example.com",
        "subcategory": "user@example.com",
        "subject": "string_value",
        "description": "Sample description text",
        "fileUrl": "https://example.com/image.png",
        "recaptchaResponse": "string_value"
      }'

Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.

  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"

private-bookings

1 endpoints

POST /private-bookings OPTIONAL AUTH main-backend-microservices/alpha-muvi-gateway-main/src/main/controllers/private-booking.controller.ts
Headers
Acceptapplication/jsonrequired
accept-languageEN | ARrequired
x-device-platformandroid | ios | web | kioskoptional
Content-Typeapplication/jsonrequired
AuthorizationBearer <token>optional
Arguments
emailstringrequired
cinemaIdnumberrequired
cityIdnumberrequired
experienceIdnumberrequired
filmstringrequired
fullNamestringrequired
numberOfGuestsnumberrequired
phoneNumberstringrequired
preferdDateTimestringrequired
recaptchaResponsestringoptional
Example Request
$ curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/private-bookings \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "accept-language: EN | AR" \
  -H "x-device-platform: android | ios | web | kiosk" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  -d '{
        "email": "user@example.com",
        "cinemaId": "user@example.com",
        "cityId": "user@example.com",
        "experienceId": "user@example.com",
        "film": "user@example.com",
        "fullName": "user@example.com",
        "numberOfGuests": "user@example.com",
        "phoneNumber": "user@example.com",
        "preferdDateTime": "user@example.com",
        "recaptchaResponse": "user@example.com"
      }'
Request Body (editable JSON)
Response
Click “Try it →” to send a live request.
